alert.note: Alert for Ripley (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 25 at 9:03PM CDT until March 27 at 8:21PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri... Current River near Doniphan .Minor flooding continues along the Current River near Doniphan. Water levels continue to rise, and the river is forecast to crest just shy of moderate flood stage near 17.9 feet Sunday afternoon. The river will then begin a quick fall, dropping below flood stage Monday afternoon. For the Current River...including Doniphan...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Current River near Doniphan. * WHEN...Until Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Water begins to flood homes in Doniphan. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 16.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.9 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.8 feet on 05/02/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
